channel.description: Better nannying for North Carolina starts here!

image.title: NC PAN Webmaster – North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies

item.title: FREE! Raising a Healthy, Happy Teen Summit [Online]
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Learn from experts about big questions and concerns of parents and caregivers of teens. You'll walk away with practical take-aways, as well as inspiration for this season of life.
item.content:encoded:
First, the quick info you want:

Cost: FREE | When: Tuesday, March 7 to Friday, March 10

Sign up by clicking HERE.

We wanted to make you aware of an opportunity for those nannies who work with teens, or who work with charges soon to be teens, to gain professional development training for free.

The Raising a Healthy, Happy Teen Summit runs from March 7, 2023 to March 10, 2023, entirely online. New sessions are posted daily, and the sessions are only viewable for 24 hours.

Before you scroll further, if you are a current NC PAN supporting member, log in! There are portions of this post that only you can see!

Learn from experts about big questions and concerns of parents and caregivers of teens. You’ll walk away with practical take-aways, as well as inspiration for this season of life. Some of the experts giving presentations at this summit are those we on your North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies board follow for advice to improve our professional skills. Of note is Ash Brandin, @thegamereducator on Instagram, who combines their professional training as a mathematics instructor with their career experience teaching middle grades to analyze the scholarship on screens and video games and advise adults how to effectively incorporate some screen time and some games into a household structure.

That is too good not to share! Advanced registration is required to gain access to the talks.

Register for the Teen Summit

For North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies supporting members:

We will be hosting a follow-up review session on Tuesday, March 14th starting at 6:30 pm, to go over what the key take-aways were from the conference, and to compare notes with one another (we cannot all manage to attend every session, after all).

If you aren’t a supporting member and want to attend the study session, there’s a unique opportunity for you!

Supporting Members, you will receive your connection details by email, even if you don’t register for the conference.

In addition, in order to cut down on email spam, you don’t have to register for the conference. We will share our registration access links with you. Starting with …

  • Successfully Registered Email
  • Link to Access the Presentations Each Day
  • Bonus Day

We look forward to seeing everyone at one (or both) of these opportunities!

item.title: FREE! Milestones and Concerns training from the CDC [Online]
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: This is an on-demand training aimed at ECE teachers which educates us about the new developmental milestones, how to spot them, and when to raise concerns. It is entirely free (taxpayer funded). In addition, this training offers CEU credits good toward maintaining an educator licenses. That is too good not to share!
item.content:encoded:
Where:Â CDC Website

We wanted to make you aware of an opportunity gain professional development training for free with CEU credit.

Hat tip to former NC PAN Social Chair, Nanny Denny for the alert.

This is an on-demand training aimed at ECE teachers which educates us about the new developmental milestones, how to spot them, and when to raise concerns. It is entirely free (taxpayer funded). In addition, this training offers CEU credits good toward maintaining an educator licenses. It is offered by the Centers of Disease Control; a reputable provider.

That is too good not to share!

The CDC Course

item.title: Holiday Secret Gift Exchange 2022
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Looking to add a little nanny cheer to your upcoming winter celebrations? Nanny Beth has created a Nannies Only gift exchange (sometimes known as a secret Santa exchange) for us! Details in the post.
item.content:encoded:
Looking to add a little nanny cheer to your upcoming winter celebrations? Nanny Beth has created a Nannies Only gift exchange (sometimes known as a secret Santa exchange) for us!

Click on this Facebook group, fill out the getting to know you post, and wait to see who your match is. Then make sure you pick out the perfect gift and send it by the deadline.

Gift price target is $30. Sign up by 21 November 2022. Ship gifts on 10 December 2022.

item.title: FREE! Happy Family Conference [Online]
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: The Happily Family Conference is something we look forward to attending each year with eager anticipation ðŸŽ‰ because it is evidence- and science-based to provide data-driven parenting techniques and information. We will be hosting a follow-up review session to go over what the key take-aways were from the conference, and to compare notes with one another (we cannot all manage to attend every session, after all). If you aren't a supporting member and want to attend the study session, there's a unique opportunity for you! For THIS conference only, if you take a screenshot of your conference registration and send it to us, you're in. That's how much we believe this conference is beneficial to your career and upskilling!
item.content:encoded:
First, the quick info you want:

Cost: FREE | When: Thursday, November 10 to Monday, November 14 at 3 am Eastern

Sign up by clicking HERE.

Initially recommended to us by one of our member nannies (Nicole, we see you!) who attends every year, and having completely won over this writer, The Happily Family Conference is something we look forward to attending each year with eager anticipation because it is evidence- and science-based to provide data-driven parenting techniques and information.

Before you scroll further, if you are a current NC PAN supporting member, log in! There are portions of this post that only you can see!

This year, the theme is

Mindful Parenting and Emotional Wellness

and features five days of experts providing us with their wisdom.

We look forward to seeing you there!

Here is the pitch that Happy Family makes for what you will learn in the conference:

You will gather together with other parents and professionals who embrace a conscious and mindful approach to raising kids.

You will gather with others who know that in order to help kids be resilient, motivated, calm and connected, it starts with looking at ourselves.

The Happily Family Conference focuses on how to help kids cope with their anxiety, stress, anger, negativity, get along with others, and do their best. This event is also about looking inward toward ourselves, as well as outward to the kids.

During this 5 day event, you will see 25 interviews from some of the finest teachers, authors, researchers, and thought leaders in the world of parenting, mindfulness, and personal growth such as:

  • Dr. Daniel Siegel talks about Imperfect Parenting, Self-Awareness, and Repair
  • Dr. Kristin Neff talks about Self-Compassion
  • Dayna Abraham talks about Calming the Chaos of Everyday Family Life
  • Janine Halloran talks about Coping Skills for Kids with Stress, Anxiety, and Anger
Get all the details and register at NO COST here.

Topics in this Conference include

  • Coping skills for kids dealing with worry, perfectionism, overwhelming feelings, or negative self-talk 
  • Handling parenting triggers to lessen our own stress, frustration, and anxiety 
  • How to support children when theyâ€™re struggling at school 
  • Special topics like self-harm, suicide, gender-diverse kids, and being anti-racist 
  • Healthy habits for screens and social media 

Get all the details and register at NO COST here. >

This is the largest and longest running online parenting conference out there. It will bring together over 150k parents and professionals from over 187 countries all around the world. You can join the conversation about how to raise kids who are mentally and emotionally healthy, happy, and resilient.

For North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies supporting members:

We will be hosting a follow-up review session on Tuesday, November 15th starting at 6:30 pm, to go over what the key take-aways were from the conference, and to compare notes with one another (we cannot all manage to attend every session, after all).

If you aren’t a supporting member and want to attend the study session, there’s a unique opportunity for you!

For this conference only, if you take a screenshot of your conference registration and send it to us >, we’ll reply to your message with the connection details. You won’t get that offer for any other online professional development opportunity. That’s how much we believe this conference is beneficial to your career and upskilling!

Supporting Members, you will receive your connection details by email, even if you don’t register for the conference.

In addition, in order to cut down on email spam, you don’t have to register for the conference. We will share our registration access links with you. Starting with …

  • Successfully Registered Email
  • Day 1
  • Day 2
  • Day 3
  • Day 4
  • Day 5
  • Bonus Day

We look forward to seeing everyone at one (or both) of these opportunities!

You can learn about all the previous Happily Family Conferences that we’ve promoted by clicking on this link >.

item.title: FREE! Pediatric Sleep Solutions [Online]
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: This is an on-demand summit session that appears as part of a much larger conference on sleep. You will need to RSVP for the entire conference (free) but you aren't required to attend all of the sessions.
item.content:encoded:
When: October 23rd | Where: Part of the Sleep Super Conference | RSVP For the Whole Conference

We wanted to make you aware of an opportunity to attend a professional development training for free.

Before you scroll further, if you are a current NC PAN supporting member, log in! There are portions of this post that only you can see!

This is an on-demand summit session that appears as part of a much larger conference on sleep. You will need to RSVP for the entire conference (free) but you aren’t required to attend all of the sessions.

On the 23rd of October, make sure to log in and watch this conference session. You can watch it whenever you want within the 24-hours, but after that, free access is removed.

If you are a Supporting Member, we will be hosting an encore presentation and discussion on the 27th of October, starting at 6:30 pm.

Since you are a Supporting Member, we wanted to make you aware of an encore presentation and discussion on the 27th of October, starting at 6:30 pm.

Attend by clicking here > at the appointed hour.

In addition, Supporting Members don’t need to sign up for their own registration and receive all the email upsells. They can just attend on our link >. [ADD CONFERENCE TO YOUR CALENDAR >]

Once again,

RSVP via this link
Access encore presentation

item.title: Pumpkin Picking (2022)
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Come join us again to pick pumpkins, learn about farming, and (most importantly) play in a giant dried corn pit! That's right, we are going pumpkin picking!
item.content:encoded:
Come join us again to pick pumpkins, learn about farming, and (most importantly) play in a giant dried corn pit! That’s right, we are going pumpkin picking!

Attend
Host
Share

Here are the outings that have been scheduled and sent to us, alphabetically by North Carolina region:

Triangle Region

When: Thursday, October 13, 2022 @ 9 am – 1 pm floating rescheduled due to weather to Thursday, October 20, 2022 @ 9 am – 1 pm floating

Where: Page Farms; 6100 Mt Herman Rd, Raleigh, NC 27617; +19195963227

Who: All caregivers and their children. Invitation extended especially – but not exclusively – to the members of the Triangle Nanny Tribe Facebook group.

Cost: There is a cost associated with this outing, and is to be paid directly to Paige Farm on arrival. Included in your admission fee is the free pumpkin that you pick.
â€‹
RSVP: On this Facebook event.

In a Different Region?

Volunteer as host for your region’s pumpkin picking during an October day! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN webmaster via webmaster@ncpan.org to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area. And on top of that, we offer you a little something for being an organizer

All social events are volunteer hosted by nannies!

Spread the Word!

Share this image to your favorite social media outlet, and add the details of your local region’s Pumpkin Picking!

item.title: iNNRW: Why I love being/having a nanny!
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: National Nanny Recognition Week isn't just for families to honor nannies, nor for nannies to honor each other, but is also for nannies to honor themselves. // Employers, let your nanny know why s/he is appreciated. Post your thoughts on this topic to your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, personal blog, or as a comment on our iNNRW daily post, and then share those thoughts with your nanny!
item.content:encoded:
Why I Love Being a Nanny

National Nanny Recognition Week isn’t just for families to honor nannies, nor for nannies to honor each other, but is also for nannies to honor themselves. Come to our Facebook page and find the post-promt to tell the world why you love being a nanny!

Why I Love Having a Nanny

Employers, let your nanny know why s/he is appreciated. Post your thoughts on this topic to your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, personal blog, or as a comment on our iNNRW daily post, and then share those thoughts with your nanny!

If you do not have social media accounts, you can submit by emailing to communications@ncpan.orgÂ and our teamÂ will post on your behalf at the end of the day.

Thank you all for starting the celebration off right!

Check out previous years’ posts!

item.title: FREE! Emergent Literacy – Phonological Awareness [Online]
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Over the next couple of months, Thrive Nannies will be focusing on emergent literacy, and how you can help your nanny kid develop their early reading skills. For September, they will focus on one aspect of emergent literacy, called Phonological Awareness. You will learn what this phonological awareness is, and fun activities and games to help your nanny kid develop this foundational component of reading.
item.content:encoded:
